title: Ratio of electric fields on surface of 2 spheres

content.question: Isolated conducting spheres 1 and 2 have radii <math alttext="R sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="R sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>, respectively. The spheres are separated by a large distance, and spheres 1 and 2 have charges of <math alttext="positive Q sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mi>Q</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="positive Q sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mi>Q</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>, respectively. The electric field at the surface of sphere 1 is <math alttext="E sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>E</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>, and the electric field at the surface of sphere 2 is <math alttext="E sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>E</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>. The ratio <math alttext="E sub 1, over E sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>E</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mo>/</mo><msub><mrow><mi>E</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> is

choices.label: <math alttext="the fraction with numerator, Q sub 1 times R sub 2, and denominator, Q sub 2 times R sub 1, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>Q</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>Q</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator, Q sub 1 times R sub 1, and denominator, Q sub 2 times R sub 2, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>Q</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>Q</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator Q sub 1, times R sub 2, squared, and denominator Q sub 2, times R sub 1, squared, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>Q</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><msubsup><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msubsup></mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>Q</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msubsup><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msubsup></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator Q sub 1, times R sub 1, squared, and denominator Q sub 2, times R sub 2, squared, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>Q</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><msubsup><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msubsup></mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>Q</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msubsup><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msubsup></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator Q sub 2, times R sub 1, squared, and denominator Q sub 1, times R sub 2, squared, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>Q</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msubsup><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msubsup></mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>Q</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><msubsup><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msubsup></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the fraction with numerator Q sub 1, times R sub 2, squared, and denominator Q sub 2, times R sub 1, squared, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>Q</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><msubsup><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msubsup></mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>Q</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msubsup><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msubsup></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

unit.text: 8: Electric Charges, Fields, and Gauss's Law

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
